definition: to float away/to drift/to be swept off
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: The life boat slowly drifted away from the sinking ship.
sentences.chinese: 救生船慢慢地从下沉的船旁边漂走。

sentences.english: The current was drifting us along.
After that the earthen pot floated away.
My raft drifts if it is not steered.
sentences.chinese: 我的小筏子如不被驾驶，即会漂走。

sentences.english: The boat full of passengers was set adrift.
sentences.chinese: 满载旅客的船被漂走了。

sentences.english: Ice expected to drift away in your position.
sentences.chinese: 冰预计在你船处会漂走。

sentences.english: Ice expected to drift away in the area around Snakes Island.
sentences.chinese: 靠近蛇岛附近的冰将会漂走。

sentences.english: The boat has gone adrift and there is no one board!
sentences.chinese: 小船漂走了，船上一个人也没有人了。

sentences.english: The piece of paper fell onto the surface of the river and drifted away out of sight.
sentences.chinese: 这张纸掉到了河面上，漂走看不见了。

sentences.english: Someone said they should -keep the body from drifting away.
sentences.chinese: 有人说应该想办法别让尸体漂走。

definition: variant of 飄盪|飘荡[piao1 dang4]
to float on the current/to drift along or about/rafting
Shuili township in Nantou county 南投縣|南投县[Nan2 tou2 xian4], central Taiwan
